headline: Tesla locked in talks with Chile’s SQM over lithium investment
snippet: Tesla is in talks with Chile’s largest lithium producer SQM about investing in supplies of the battery material, as it ramps up production of its first mass-market electric car.

headline: Tianqi readies HK listing ahead of SQM deal
snippet: China’s biggest producer of lithium, the battery raw material, has chosen Morgan Stanley and CLSA for a listing in Hong Kong to fund its $4.07bn purchase of a stake in Chile’s SQM, according to a prospectus.

headline: Tianqi Lithium buys into Chile’s SQM
snippet: Shenzhen-listed Tianqi paid a 12 per cent premium for the SQM shares held by Canada’s Nutrien, which was required to sell as part of the merger between PotashCorp and Agrium that created it.

headline: Batteries power Tianqi’s quest for lithium producer
snippet: Takeover bid for SQM signals China’s ambition to take lead in the electric car supply chain

headline: Lithium faces $5bn test as supplier stake sale electrifies buyer interest
snippet: When Canadian fertiliser company PotashCorp acquired shares in Chile’s SQM almost 20 years ago, the latter’s lithium business appeared an afterthought.

headline: Shares of lithium producers Albemarle and SQM rattled by gloomy forecast
snippet: Shares in US-listed Albemarle fell as much as 10 per cent, while those of rival SQM dropped 8 per cent after analysts at Morgan Stanley cautioned that the lithium price could plunge 45 per cent over the next four years.

headline: Speed read
snippet: Lithium overload Chinese companies disrupted a market controlled by Chile’s SQM and Albemarle and FMC of the US

Sinochem chases $4bn lithium stake
snippet: Sinochem, China’s state chemical group, is among bidders for a $4bn stake in Chile’s SQM, one of the world’s largest producers of lithium, a key component in electric car batteries.

headline: Lithium price poised for recovery, says Tianqi boss
snippet: Tianqi has been the world’s most acquisitive global lithium company in the past few years, buying Australia’s largest lithium mine, Greenbushes, in 2013, and last year paying $4.1bn for a 24 per cent stake in Chile’s SQM.

headline: Companies / Sectors / People

Stalled market Lithium knocked by oversupply and cut in electric-vehicle subsidy
snippet: Chile’s SQM, the world’s second-largest producer, last week said its earnings for the second quarter had almost halved, to $70.2m, because of lower lithium prices.

headline: Companies / Sectors / People

China’s ambitious investment push into Chile reflects shift in region’s political winds
snippet: China has seized the opportunity. Tianqi Lithium Corp snapped up a 24 per cent stake in SQM, a Chilean lithium miner, for $4bn, the country’s biggest foreign investment in 2018. Chinese companies have also invested in the electricity, renewable energy, salmon and fruit sectors in the past year.

headline: Tesla signs deal with Australia’s Kidman Resources
snippet: Kidman is developing the Mount Holland hard rock lithium project in Western Australia in a joint venture with Chile’s SQM, the world’s second-largest producer of the battery raw material.

headline: Chinese groups go where western rivals fear to tread
snippet: Their largest acquisition last year was the $4.1bn purchase of a 24 per cent stake in Chilean lithium miner SQM by China’s Tianqi Lithium.

headline: Trio of lithium IPOs will fuel debate on electric vehicles
snippet: The largest producers in Chile — Albemarle and SQM — have pledged to expand supply while a host of new mines are being developed, spanning Canada to Australia.

headline: Tesla in stand-off over lithium supply for factory
snippet: Analysts say Albemarle of Baton Rouge, FMC Lithium of Philadelphia and SQM of Chile, the big producers of lithium, have not been willing to supply at the prices Tesla has demanded.

headline: Rio Tinto hails ‘eureka moment’ after large lithium discovery in California
snippet: In 2017, Rio was said to have looked at acquiring a stake in Chile’s SQM, the world’s second-largest producer, but China’s Tianqi Lithium ended up buying a stake in the company.

headline: The day in the markets What you need to know
snippet: Lithium miner Albemarle and technology partner Livent were dragged down after Chilean mining company SQM announced that earnings had plummeted by nearly half due to a slump in prices for the battery metal. Harry Dempsey

headline: Australia housing fall raises recession fear
snippet: Developers are increasingly offering incentives to tempt buyers, amid weakening sales that have caused the volume of property listings to jump by a quarter in Melbourne and 16.5 per cent in Sydney over the past year, according to data provider SQM Research.

headline: Niche bets on Burgundy wine and cannabis pay off

headline: Nissan scraps $1bn sale of battery unit to Chinese buyout group
snippet: Since then the group, led by deal-maker Sonny Wu, has appeared in a number of high-profile auctions for overseas assets. In the second half of last year it entered the race for a stake in SQM, the Chilean lithium producer, but was beaten by Tianqi, the Chinese battery maker.

headline: Metals are the new black gold as race to control battery resources turns geopolitical
snippet: Last week a Chinese company, Tianqi Lithium, snapped up a significant stake in Chile’s largest lithium producer, SQM, despite opposition from some in the South American country who say the deal is handing China a monopoly over lithium supply.

headline: Carmakers race to secure battery raw materials
snippet: This month, BMW said it was close to signing a deal for the long-term supply of battery metals lithium and cobalt, while Tesla is also in talks with Chile’s SQM, one of the world’s largest lithium producers.

headline: What to watch in metals during the coming year
snippet: One of the largest producers, Chile’s SQM, is in talks to resolve a dispute over how much lithium it can produce following the election of Sebastián Piñera as president this month.

headline: Chile’s Piñera aims to benefit from Latin America’s swing to right
snippet: Perhaps the former magnate’s greatest weakness are accusations of conflicts of interest. Although he has successfully deflected charges related to his overseas investments, an investigation was opened last month over whether he received illegal campaign funds in his 2009 presidential bid from the mining company, SQM.

headline: BlackRock bets big on lithium’s electric-car future
snippet: Lithium production is currently dominated by four large players, Chile’s SQM, FMC, Albemarle and Tianqi Lithium. But a host of smaller companies are racing to bring supply to the market and get their material approved for use in batteries.
